answers.answer: I don't see any suggestions by anyone yet, but I have a very similar thing.  It feels as though someone is gently pushing on the back of my eye ball.  It's not "painful" but dull and it get so annoying I can't think about anything else.  It usually comes for a few days and then it goes away for a few months but comes back.  Any ideas! Hawaiin Girl and I would love some suggestions...

I believe you meant "iritis" which might cause the symptoms your describe. However a negative exam by two Eye MDs and a rheumatologist should exclude this as a cause.I would suggest a neurologist or a neuro-ophthalmologist. This might represent Cluster headaches or facial neuralgias.Good luck. Let us know if your get a definitive diagnosis.JCH III MD  eye physician and surgeon

I have had chronic red eyes for a 1 1/2 years.  My eye  doctor discontinued all my eye medications for over a month to see if medication was the cause, but they continued to be red.  I washed my eye lids with sterilid twice daily and applying warm compresses and this did not help.  I do have glaucoma but the doctor said that did not contribute to the redness.  Can you make any suggestions?
My right eye has been red  for over 3 months....no pain, no pressure, no affect with vision,,,even the specialist don't know...go figure .....

If you are not on glaucoma medicines (which often make the eye red especially alphagan) and its not iritis then other common possibilities include thyroid disease, dry eyes, blepharitis.See an MD eye physician ophthalmologist that specializes in cornea/external disease for a second opinion. Find one at www.aao.orgJCH MD

question: I have type 2 diabetes and I've been having chronic eye redness for the past 3 years in my left eye only.  My episodes comes every other month and it usually lasts for 2 weeks.  It starts with a little twitching and then a little redness and by the third day my left eye is completely red.  I feel pressure behind my eyeball which in turn gives me massive headaches.  The episode lasts for 2 weeks and then magically it goes away.  I
title: Chronic Eye Redness
